labelled_reactions.easy_desc: p-aminobenzoate + 5-phospho-α-D-ribose 1-diphosphate + H+ = 4-(β-D-ribofuranosyl)aminobenzene-5'-phosphate + CO2 + diphosphate (#BiochemicalReaction722965: BIOCHEMICAL_RXN cofactors:[] stoichiometry:1.0 x H+, 1.0 x p-aminobenzoate, 1.0 x CO2, 1.0 x 5-phospho-α-D-ribose 1-diphosphate, 1.0 x diphosphate, 1.0 x 4-(β-D-ribofuranosyl)aminobenzene-5'-phosphate)

labelled_reactions.notes: This is a plausible reaction.  It could be described by an hchERO, and I even would expect my code to generate one from it.  However, it will be a super-rare reaction because the entire ring, amino group, plus the carboxyl group will be pulled in.
labelled_reactions.easy_desc: 4-aminobenzoyl-CoA + 15 malonyl-CoA + 4 (S)-methylmalonyl-CoA + 28 NADPH + 47 H+ -> candicinolide + 15 CO2 + 20 coenzyme A + 28 NADP+ + 16 H2O (#BiochemicalReaction856409: 2.3.1.-   BIOCHEMICAL_RXN cofactors:[] stoichiometry:16.0 x H<sub>2</sub>O, 15.0 x CO<SUB>2</SUB>, 4.0 x (S)-methylmalonyl-CoA, 20.0 x coenzyme A, 1.0 x 4-aminobenzoyl-CoA, 15.0 x malonyl-CoA, 47.0 x H<SUP>+</SUP>, 1.0 x candicinolide, 28.0 x NADPH, 28.0 x NADP<sup>+</sup>)

labelled_reactions.notes: This is a polyketide synthase reaction.  It is probably valid, but will not be well described by an hchERO.
labelled_reactions.easy_desc: 4-amino-3-hydroxybenzoate + oxygen -> (2Z,4Z)-2-amino-5-carboxymuconate-6-semialdehyde + H+ (#BiochemicalReaction666621: 1.13.11.-   BIOCHEMICAL_RXN cofactors:[24] stoichiometry:1.0 x H<SUP>+</SUP>, 1.0 x 4-amino-3-hydroxybenzoate, 1.0 x (2Z,4Z)-2-amino-5-carboxymuconate-6-semialdehyde, 1.0 x oxygen)
